sentences.en: A hawk hovered in the blue sky.
sentences.cn: 一只老鹰在蓝色的天空中翱翔.

sentences.en: A hawk hovered over the hill.
sentences.cn: 一只鹰在小山的上空翱翔。

sentences.en: A hawk hovers in the sky.
Barry is the new news hawk at the local newspaper.
sentences.cn: 巴利是这家地方报纸最新聘任的新闻记者.

sentences.en: But before the cup had touched his lips, the hawk swooped down again.
sentences.cn: 可是杯子还没有触到他的嘴唇，这只鹰又俯冲下来。

sentences.en: Go! You are sparrows chattering praise over the dead hawk.
sentences.cn: 去你的吧! 你们是麻雀在吹捧死鹰.

sentences.en: Hawk - eye is able to bring his friends safely throught the enemy lines.
sentences.cn: “鹰眼”依然能够带领朋友们安全通过敌人的防线.

sentences.en: He waited, watching her like a hawk (= watching her very closely) .
sentences.cn: 他等待着，用鹰一样锐利的目光紧盯着她。

sentences.en: His pet hawk had left his wrist and flown away.
sentences.cn: 他那宝贝的鹰已经不在他的手腕上,飞走了.

sentences.en: In the fall, they returned to Kitty Hawk.
sentences.cn: 秋天, 他们又回到基蒂霍克.

sentences.en: Oil thieves sometimes hawk stolen gasoline on the side of highways.
sentences.cn: 石油大盗们有时在公路边上兜售偷来的石油。

sentences.en: She watched his every move like a hawk.
sentences.cn: 她像鹰一样注视着他的每一个动作。

sentences.en: The hawk chops upon its prey.
sentences.cn: 老鹰猛地向它要捕食的动物扑去.

sentences.en: The hawk poised in mid-air ready to swoop.
sentences.cn: 老鹰在半空中盘旋，准备俯冲。

sentences.en: The hawk pounced on its prey and carried it off.
sentences.cn: 那只鹰向那小动物猛扑过去把它叼走了.

sentences.en: The hawk snatched the chicken and flew away.
sentences.cn: 老鹰叼了小鸡就飞走了.

sentences.en: The hawk swooped and soared away carrying something.
sentences.cn: 那只鹰向下猛冲，抓住东西后又展翅高飞了。

sentences.en: The hawk swooped down and seized the rabbit.
sentences.cn: 老鹰突然向下猛扑并抓住了兔子.

sentences.en: The hawk swooped down on the rabbit and killed it.
sentences.cn: 鹰猛地朝兔子扑下来,并把它杀死.

words.tran_cn: 袭击；翱翔；攫取（hawk的现在分词）
[鸟]鹰；鹰派成员；掠夺他人的人
清嗓；咳嗽；像鹰一般地袭击
兜售，沿街叫卖；捕捉；咳出

phrases.tran_cn: 黑鹰直升机（80年代美军主力通用直升机）
小鹰号航空母舰 （战斗群） （美）；基蒂霍克（美国北卡罗莱纳州一小村庄）

trans.tran_en: a large bird that hunts and eats small birds and animals
to try to sell goods, usually by going from place to place and trying to persuade people to buy them
to try to sell goods, usually by going from place to place and trying to persuade people to buy them
